briefing.opening: Good morning. We will now begin the climate briefing for December 17, 2025.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Escalating Climate Crisis and Global Impact
sections.content: According to news collected today, the impacts of the climate crisis are intensifying globally. Recently, global temperatures reached record highs [56], and 'unprecedented warming' has occurred [51]. The Arctic is experiencing a year of record heatwaves, with climate scientists warning of a 'redefinition of winter' [39]. These changes are also leading to research indicating that polar bear DNA is being rewritten [27, 31, 40]. Furthermore, in China, winter records are on the verge of being broken [53], and in Washington State, climate change has set the stage for historic floods [29]. In Asia, deadly floods have occurred, causing significant damage [58]. The impacts on ecosystems are also severe; domestically, a warning has been issued that medicinal plants are endangered due to climate change, potentially threatening the health of 80% of the world's population [2], and the French wine industry is facing an existential crisis [4]. Alpine glaciers are projected to reach their peak rate of disappearance within 8 years [42]. Young people in Pacific island nations are confronting this climate crisis and seeking advocates [5]. With Hurricane Melissa leaving a trail of emotional devastation across Jamaica [48], climate change is having widespread and severe impacts globally.

sections.title: âš ï¸ Policy Challenges and the Reality of Carbon Neutrality Goals
sections.content: Policy efforts to address the climate crisis continue to face significant challenges. Domestically, concerns have been raised, pointing out the illusion of the '2035 carbon neutrality' target and calling for a halt to this unreflective pursuit [7]. Representative Park Joo-sun emphasized that oil's role remains significant even amidst carbon neutrality and that energy security must be strengthened [13]. He also cited the U.S., China, and the EU easing their efforts on carbon neutrality, requesting an adjustment to the pace of Korea's NDC (Nationally Determined Contribution, or national greenhouse gas reduction target) [14]. Internationally, New York has reportedly stepped back from climate change response efforts [26], and there are reports that Spain's commitment to renewable energy transition is wavering [36]. UK supermarket Morrisons has postponed its net-zero targets [41], and the COP30 climate summit revealed sharp divisions [38]. The EU has agreed to ease corporate sustainability legislation [59], among other developments, indicating that globally, significant difficulties and disagreements exist in pursuing policies to achieve carbon neutrality targets.

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Domestic and international efforts for renewable energy transition and carbon neutrality
sections.content: Despite these challenges, positive efforts continue both domestically and internationally towards renewable energy transition and achieving carbon neutrality. Among domestic companies, Hyundai Glovis demonstrated a leading role by achieving the highest rating in the CDP Climate Change Response assessment [1]. The Korea Development Bank plans to provide 1 trillion won by 2030 to support the cement industry's transition to carbon neutrality [6]. Seongbuk-gu is addressing the climate crisis by operating carbon neutrality policy promotion boards with the goal of 'achieving 2050 carbon neutrality' [8, 10]. At the government level, President Lee praised the Director of Renewable Energy for Sinan-gun, emphasizing the importance of the renewable energy sector [16, 20], and the Democratic Party met with the Korea Chamber of Commerce and Industry, promising the swift passage of the Special Act on Renewable Energy Self-Sufficient Cities [17]. Korea Southern Power (KOSPO) carried out organizational restructuring and personnel changes to focus on eco-friendly renewable energy transition [18], and Haenam-gun is accelerating efforts to attract renewable energy fabs [19]. Namwon City plans to construct a new and renewable energy exhibition and experience facility utilizing waste heat from incinerators [22], and discussions on the integration of the five power generation companies have been reignited with the proposal of the Public Renewable Energy Act [23]. Internationally, special breakwaters have been installed in Miami Shores to reverse the effects of climate change [30], and Catawba College is paving the way for a transition from coal to carbon neutrality [32]. Siemens is contributing by providing decarbonization and energy efficiency solutions [35], and energy system operators have assessed that net-zero scenarios are the 'cheapest option' for the UK [55]. Furthermore, various efforts are underway in different countries to achieve carbon neutrality goals, including contributions from China's 'mid-level officials' in shaping climate policy [57, 45].

sections.title: ğŸ“° Key Discussion Points in Climate Policy and Science
sections.content: Various policy discussions and scientific explorations are actively underway regarding climate change. Alongside arguments that the active consideration of overseas renewable energy imports is necessary to achieve the 2035 NDC (Nationally Determined Contribution) [21], there are calls for government support, including for renewable energy imports and carbon-neutral fuels, to precede NDC implementation [25]. Domestically, pathways to carbon neutrality for thermal energy are being explored [11], and the Goyang City Council discussed establishing a carbon-neutral governance system [12]. The refining industry held a conference to explore AI, supply stability, and carbon-neutral solutions [15]. Internationally, the European Environment Agency (EEA) is providing information on renewable energy [34], and research is underway to uncover clues about the warming Arctic through polar bear DNA [40]. Prime Minister Mia Mottley emphasized the urgent need for methane reduction [44]. There was also an article on why cities need more than just air conditioning during heatwaves [50], and while the 'Kali Fund' for nature conservation aimed to raise billions of dollars, its initial donation was only $1,000, highlighting early challenges [52]. As discussions continue on five key climate questions for China's next 'Five-Year Plan' [54], multifaceted approaches and the search for solutions to climate change are ongoing.

briefing.closing: This concludes today's climate briefing. We would like to reiterate the importance of sustained attention and effort regarding climate change as we close. Thank you.
